ai-ud8.10:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud8.10:2.1_0: “Mendicants, when Dabba the Mallian rose into the air and, sitting cross-legged in the sky, entered and withdrew from the fire element before becoming fully extinguished, his body burning and combusting left neither ashes nor soot to be found.
ai-ud8.10:2.2_0: It’s like when ghee or oil blaze and burn, and neither ashes nor soot are found.
ai-ud8.10:2.3_0: In the same way, when Dabba the Mallian rose into the air and, sitting cross-legged in the sky, entered and withdrew from the fire element before becoming fully extinguished, his body burning and combusting left neither ashes nor soot to be found.”
ai-ud8.10:3.1_0: Then, knowing the significance of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud8.10:4.4_0: As the earth did not consum.
ai-ud8.10:5.1_0: In the same way for the rightly released,
ai-ud8.10:5.2_0: who have crossed the flood of sensual bonds,
ai-ud8.10:5.4_0: where they have gone cannot be found.”
ai-ud8.10:5.6_0: The eighth sub-chapter on Pāṭaligāma is finished.
ai-ud8.10:6.1_0: they have spoken of four bases,
ai-ud8.10:7.1_0: this was the first Bodhi tree,
ai-ud8.10:7.3_0: The third sub-chapter on Nandaka is finished.
ai-ud8.10:7.4_0: The fourth part of Meghiya and Meghiya.
ai-ud8.10:9.2_0: (While) I discovered the well-spoked food and drink,
ai-ud8.10:9.3_0: shown by the seer, the Visionary One,
ai-ud8.10:9.4_0: for sure it is the top of your house,
